item.title: The more you know, the less you need.
item.description: â€œThe more you know, the less you need. The experienced fly fisherman with only one rod, one type of fly, and one type of line will always outfish the duffer with an entire quiver of gear and flies. I never forget Thoreau's advice: 'I say beware of all enterprises that require new clothes...'" —Yvon Chouinard in Let My People Go Surfing. Chouinard is a mountain climber, environmentalist, and founder of Patagonia.

item.title: Debussy on White Space
item.description: "Music is the space between the notes." —Claude Debussy, as quoted in Turning Numbers into Knowledge (2001) by Johnathan G. Koomey

item.title: Ed Parker on Competition
item.description: "It is always better to improve and strengthen your own line or knowledge than to try and cut your opponent's line." —Ed Parker, Martial Arts Instructor and Author
